DataElement.preferredName: Patient Consent Additional  Biopsy Cancer Biobank Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Added; extra; further._A repository of biospecimens - including tissue samples, fluids such as blood, serum and urine, and molecular derivatives such as DNA, RNA and proteins pertaining to cancer research. The repository has stringent guidelines regarding the standardized collection, handling, storage and documentation of biological specimens. These guidelines enable an extensive system for specimen storage that allows for the accurate establishment of disease incidences over long periods of time._The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis._Permission to do something._Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures._The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Added; extra; further.:A repository of biospecimens - including tissue samples, fluids such as blood, serum and urine, and molecular derivatives such as DNA, RNA and proteins pertaining to cancer research. The repository has stringent guidelines regarding the standardized collection, handling, storage and documentation of biological specimens. These guidelines enable an extensive system for specimen storage that allows for the accurate establishment of disease incidences over long periods of time.:The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: A repository of biospecimens - including tissue samples, fluids such as blood, serum and urine, and molecular derivatives such as DNA, RNA and proteins pertaining to cancer research. The repository has stringent guidelines regarding the standardized collection, handling, storage and documentation of biological specimens. These guidelines enable an extensive system for specimen storage that allows for the accurate establishment of disease incidences over long periods of time.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Permission to do something.:Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.

Concepts.definition: Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default conceptual domain for all cancer treatment trials
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: 10.14.20 TL changed WFS from RELEASED-NON-CMPLNT to RETIRED ARCHIVED per Brian Campbell and added an End Date in preparation of OneData.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: If my cancer responds to trea
ReferenceDocuments.description: If my cancer responds to treatment on this study, and then gets worse, I agree to have an optional biopsy to collect a sample of tissue. I agree to have this tumor tissue and related information kept in a Biobank for use in future health research.

ReferenceDocuments.name: If the cancer in my body responds to treatment on this study, and then gets worse, I agree to have an optional biopsy to collect a sample of tissue. I agree to have this tumor tissue and related information kept in a Biobank for use in future health resea
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the cancer in my body responds to treatment on this study, and then gets worse, I agree to have an optional biopsy to collect a sample of tissue. I agree to have this tumor tissue and related information kept in a Biobank for use in future health research.
